title: [Feat]: Replace the opensuse info in the wiki
body:
### Describe the feature

The info in the wiki for the opensuse installation is pretty unusual and should be replaced

### Motivation

The way to install the rpm package on opensuse is more like so:

---

## Installation

### Step 1: Import GPG Key

```bash
curl -1sLf -o /tmp/teams-for-linux.asc https://repo.teamsforlinux.de/teams-for-linux.asc && sudo rpm --import /tmp/teams-for-linux.asc && rm -f /tmp/teams-for-linux.asc
```

### Step 2: Add Repository

```bash
sudo curl -1sLf -o /etc/zypp/repos.d/teams-for-linux.repo https://repo.teamsforlinux.de/rpm/teams-for-linux.repo
```

### Step 3: Refresh and Install

```bash
sudo zypper refresh && sudo zypper install teams-for-linux
```

When prompted about unsigned repository metadata, choose:
- `yes` to accept once
- `a` to accept always (recommended to avoid future prompts)

**Alternative:** Skip metadata GPG checks by modifying the repo file:
```bash
sudo sed -i 's/gpgcheck=1/gpgcheck=1\nrepo_gpgcheck=0/' /etc/zypp/repos.d/teams-for-linux.repo
```

---

I have it installed that way. I am not sure if one should recommend the removal of the check, but just in case I added it. I don't know what the heck the wiki entry is on about, but that's not how you do it and the described way lets you update through zypper without hacks.
